net.viktorc.detroid.framework.engine

Class Position

  • Object
    • Position

  • public class Position
extends Object
    A bitboard based chess position class that stores information about the side to move, en passant and castling rights, the board position, all the moves made, and all the previous position states. It allows for the generation, making, and taking back of chess moves.
    Author:
    Viktor

    • Method Detail

      • parse

        public static Position parse(String fen)
                      throws ChessParseException
        It parses a FEN string and initializes a position instance based on it. Beside standard six-field FEN-strings, it also accepts four-field Strings without the fifty-move rule clock and the move index.
        Parameters:
        fen - The FEN string.
        Returns:
        The position instance.
        Throws:
        ChessParseException - If the string is invalid.

        public int getHalfMoveIndex()
        Returns:
        The number of half moves made.

      • getFiftyMoveRuleClock

        public byte getFiftyMoveRuleClock()
        Returns:
        The number of half moves made since the last pawn move or capture.

      • getEnPassantRights

        public byte getEnPassantRights()
        Returns:
        The index denoting the file on which en passant is possible.

      • getWhiteCastlingRights

        public byte getWhiteCastlingRights()
        Returns:
        The castling type that denotes to what extent it would still be possible to castle for white regardless of whether it is actually legally executable in the current position.

      • getBlackCastlingRights

        public byte getBlackCastlingRights()
        Returns:
        The castling type that denotes to what extent it would still be possible to castle for black regardless of whether it is actually legally executable in the current position.

      • getKey

        public long getKey()
        Returns:
        A Zobrist key that is fairly close to a unique representation of the state of the instance in one 64 bit number.

      • getMoveHistory

        public ArrayDeque<Move> getMoveHistory()
        Returns:
        A queue of all the moves made so far.

      • getLastMove

        public Move getLastMove()
        Returns:
        The last move made.

      • getStateHistory

        public ArrayDeque<PositionStateRecord> getStateHistory()
        Returns:
        A queue of all the state history records so far.

      • getLastState

        public PositionStateRecord getLastState()
        Returns:
        The last position state.

      • hasRepeated

        public boolean hasRepeated(int numberOfTimes)
        Parameters:
        numberOfTimes - The hypothetical number of times the position has occurred before. E.g. for a three-fold repetition check, it would be 2.
        Returns:
        Whether the current position has already occurred before at least the specified number of times.

      • makeMove

        public void makeMove(Move move)
        Makes the specified move. No legality checks are performed.
        Parameters:
        move - The move to make.

      • makeNullMove

        public void makeNullMove()
        Makes a null move.

      • unmakeMove

        public Move unmakeMove()
        Takes back the last move made and returns it. If no move has been made yet, it returns null.
        Returns:
        The move taken back or null if no move has been made yet.

      • givesCheck

        public boolean givesCheck(Move move)
        Checks whether the specified move puts the opponent in check. The move is assumed to be legal.
        Parameters:
        move - The move to check.
        Returns:
        Whether the move checks the opponent.

      • isLegal

        public boolean isLegal(Move move)
        Determines whether the move is legal in the current position. It assumes that there exists a position in which the move is legal and checks if this one is one of them. This method may fail to detect inconsistencies in the move attributes. A fail safe way of legality checking is generating all the moves for the current position and see if the move is among them.
        Parameters:
        move - The move to perform legality check on.
        Returns:
        Whether the move is legal or not.

      • getTacticalMoves

        public List<Move> getTacticalMoves()
        Returns a list of all the legal tactical moves in the current position. Tactical moves are ordinary captures, promotions, and en passant captures.
        Returns:
        A list of all the legal tactical moves.

      • getQuietMoves

        public List<Move> getQuietMoves()
        Returns a list of all the legal quiet moves in the current position. Quiet moves are ordinary non-capture moves and castling moves.
        Returns:
        A list of all the legal quiet moves.

      • getMoves

        public List<Move> getMoves()
        Returns a list of all the legal moves in the current position.
        Returns:
        A list of all the legal moves.
